title: Sicilian Tomato Barley Soup
introduction: Sicilian Tomato Barley Soup is a hearty and comforting dish where pearl barley and fresh tomatoes come together in a savory broth. Sicilians often keep the cheese in small bits which adds a unique texture and flavor to this wholesome soup.
ingredients: 8 cups homemade Chicken Broth or Meat Broth or a mix of half store-bought broth and half water
8 ounces pearl barley, picked over and rinsed
2 medium tomatoes, peeled, seeded, and chopped, or 1 cup chopped canned tomatoes
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
instructions: Prepare the broth, if necessary. In a large pot, combine the broth, barley, and vegetables and bring to a simmer. Cook until the barley is tender, about 1 hour. Add water if the soup becomes too thick.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Spoon the soup into bowls, scattering the cheese over the top.
